attributes.action: Prevent House Of Lords peers with EU pensions/business links from voting Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
Peers with conflict of interest shouldn't be able to vote against the bill

https://www.changebritain.org/Lords

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/18/neil-kinnock-peter-mandelson-among-pro-eu-peers-looking-force/

http://christophereverard.co.uk/kinnocks-10-million-pay-off-and-the-eu-secret-bank-accounts/

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/107438/Lord-Lady-Kinnock-s-10m-Euro-gravy-train

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1192894/Revealed-How-Kinnocks-enjoyed-astonishing-10m-ride-EU-gravy-train.html
attributes.background:
Kinnock, Mandelson & Patten all have EU pensions

Kinnock also heads OLAF (EU’s agency for fighting fraud and corruption)…  and who was EU Commissioner for ten years until 2004 and with an estimated £10 million from EU earnings

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about matters that the Government or the House of Commons are responsible for. We can't accept petitions calling on the House of Lords to take action.

You can find out more about the Code of Conduct of the House of Lords here:

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/standards-and-financial-interests/house-of-lords-commissioner-for-standards-/code-of-conduct-for-the-house-of-lords/guide-to-the-code-of-conduct/
